Column Comment.0: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ABBREVIATION: Abbreviated name of the businessassociate. (usually used in reporting applications to provide a short name for abusiness associate for efficient use of space in a report on data)
Column Comment.3: BA CATEGORY: The category that the business associate is in. For a company, maybe legal company, sole proprietorship, corporation etc
Column Comment.4: BA CODE: Special code assigned to the BA by a company for internal referencepurposes
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE LONG NAME: The legal name of a business associate.(that which has been registered with a corporate registry).
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SHORT NAME: Common short name used for businessassociate. (can be used by reporting applications to make effective use of space in areport)
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE TYPE: This value is validated by check constraint to ensurethe value is in COMPANY, CONSORTIUM, GOVERNMENT or PERSON. Indicateswhich of the valid sub-types of business associate is referenced.
Column Comment.8: CREDIT CHECK DATE: The date on which the credit rating for the company was lastobtained.
Column Comment.9: CREDIT CHECK INDICATOR: a yes / no flag to indicate that a credit check has beenrun. The actual rating may or may not be inserted into the database.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: CREDIT RATING: The credit rating assigned to the company by an appropriateoutside credit review company, such as Dunn and Bradstreet.
Column Comment.12: CREDIT RATING SOURCE: the name of the outside company that assigned thecredit rating, such as Dunn and Bradstreet.
Column Comment.13: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE STATUS: The current status of the Business Associate,such as Active, In Receivership, Sold, Merged.
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the business associate become a viable entity.Only used where BA CATEGORY is not person
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the BA ceased to be a valid Business associate.
Column Comment.16: FIRST NAME: where the Business Associate is a person, the usual first name.
Column Comment.17: LAST NAME: where the Business Associate is a person, the last name in full.
Column Comment.18: MIDDLE INITIAL: where the Business Associate is a person, the middle initial.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: SERVICE PERIOD OR HOURS OF OPERATION: the time period each day whenthe business associate is open for business. Should be assumed to be the time in thelocal time zone.
Column Comment.22: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
